meanings.definition: The state or quality of being prickly.
meanings.sent1: The pricklinesses of the cactus made it difficult to touch.
meanings.sent2: I felt the pricklinesses of the hedge as I tried to trim it.
meanings.sent3: The kitten's playful attack was met with the pricklinesses of the porcupine costume.
meanings.sent4: Her words were coated with pricklinesses, making it hard to approach her.
meanings.sent5: The pricklinesses of the thorns left tiny red marks on my skin.

meanings.definition: The presence of prickles or thorns.
meanings.sent1: Walking through the forest, I encountered the pricklinesses of the bushes.
meanings.sent2: The gardener wore gloves to protect against the pricklinesses of the rose bushes.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was interrupted by the unexpected pricklinesses of the grass.
meanings.sent4: The pricklinesses of the brambles seemed to reach out and grab at my clothes.
meanings.sent5: The hiker carefully avoided the pricklinesses of the thorny vines.

meanings.definition: The tendency to be irritable or easily offended.
meanings.sent1: His pricklinesses often led to misunderstandings with his friends.
meanings.sent2: She tried to control her pricklinesses when dealing with difficult customers.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes seemed to disarm even the pricklinesses of the grumpiest audience members.
meanings.sent4: The pricklinesses in the room dissipated as soon as the tension was broken with laughter.
meanings.sent5: Dealing with her pricklinesses required a lot of patience and understanding.
